summary: The document is a classified CIA field report from October 24, 1961, detailing Manolo Ray's, the exile leader of the People's Revolutionary Movement (MRP), opposition to the invasion of Cuba. Instead, Ray advocated for Castro's overthrow through internal resistance. The report outlines the MRP's extensive organization across Cuba, including its presence in all 33 trade unions, the G-2, militia, and the administration, and its broad support among the Cuban population. Ray estimated that 80% of Cubans opposed Castro, though not all were actively resisting.
key_findings: Manolo Ray, leader of the MRP, opposed the invasion of Cuba, favoring internal resistance to overthrow Castro.
The MRP was well-organized throughout Cuba, with members in all 33 trade unions, the G-2, militia, and the administration.
Ray estimated that 80% of the Cuban population opposed Castro, though the majority were not actively opposing him.
The MRP was believed to have more support than the original revolution at the time of the report.
